    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Reference create(Repository repo,
                               String branchName,
                               Commit target,
                               boolean force)
        Create a new branch pointing at a target commit.
        Parameters:
        repo - Repository
        branchName - Name for the branch; this name is validated for consistency. It should also not conflict with an already existing branch name.
        target - Commit to which this branch should point. This object must belong to the given `repo`.
        force - Overwrite existing branch.
        Returns:
        git reference that must be closed by the caller.
        Throws:
        GitException - git error.
        IllegalStateException - if repository has already been closed.

      • createFromAnnotated

        public static Reference createFromAnnotated(Repository repo,
                                            String branchName,
                                            AnnotatedCommit annotatedCommit,
                                            boolean force)
        Create a new branch pointing at a target commit

        This behaves like `git_branch_create()` but takes an annotated commit, which lets you specify which extended sha syntax string was specified by a user, allowing for more exact reflog messages.

        See the documentation for `git_branch_create()`.

        Parameters:
        repo - repository from which the branch is created
        branchName - name of the branch to be created
        annotatedCommit - annotated commit the branch is going to point to
        force - override existing branch
        Returns:
        reference of the created branch
        Throws:
        GitException

      • delete

        public static void delete(Reference branch)
        Delete a branch and free corresponding branch reference.
        Parameters:
        branch -
        Throws:
        GitException - git error

      • move

        public static Reference move(Reference branch,
                             String branchName,
                             boolean force)
        Move/rename an existing local branch reference.

        The new branch name will be checked for validity. See `git_tag_create()` for rules about valid names.

        Note that if the move succeeds, the old reference object will not + be valid anymore, and should be freed immediately by the user using + `git_reference_free()`.

        Parameters:
        branch - Current underlying reference of the branch.
        branchName - Target name of the branch once the move is performed; this name is validated for consistency.
        force - Overwrite existing branch.
        Returns:
        New reference object for the updated name.0 on success,
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • lookup

        public static Reference lookup(Repository repo,
                               String branchName,
                               Branch.BranchType branchType)
        Lookup a branch by its name in a repository.

        The generated reference must be freed by the user. The branch name will be checked for validity.

        Parameters:
        repo - the repository to look up the branch
        branchName - Name of the branch to be looked-up; this name is validated for consistency.
        branchType - Type of the considered branch. This should be valued with either GIT_BRANCH_LOCAL or GIT_BRANCH_REMOTE.
        Returns:
        pointer to the looked-up branch reference or null when no matching branch exists.
        Throws:
        GitException - GIT_EINVALIDSPEC, otherwise an error code.

      • name

        public static String name(Reference branch)
        Get the branch name

        Given a reference object, this will check that it really is a branch (ie. it lives under "refs/heads/" or "refs/remotes/"), and return the branch part of it.

        Parameters:
        branch - A reference object, ideally pointing to a branch
        Returns:
        reference name.
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • upstream

        public static Reference upstream(Reference branch)
        Get the upstream of a branch

        Given a reference, this will return a new reference object corresponding to its remote tracking branch. The reference must be a local branch.

        Parameters:
        branch - Current underlying reference of the branch.
        Returns:
        the retrieved reference, or null when no remote tracking reference exists
        Throws:
        GitException

      • setUpstream

        public static void setUpstream(Reference branch,
                               String upstreamName)
        Set a branch's upstream branch

        This will update the configuration to set the branch named `name` as the upstream of `branch`. Pass a NULL name to unset the upstream information.

        Parameters:
        branch - the branch to configure
        upstreamName - remote-tracking or local branch to set as upstream.

      • upstreamName

        public static String upstreamName(Repository repo,
                                  String refname)
        Get the upstream name of a branch

        Given a local branch, this will return its remote-tracking branch information, as a full reference name, ie. "feature/nice" would become "refs/remote/origin/feature/nice", depending on that branch's configuration.

        Parameters:
        repo - the repository where the branches live.
        refname - reference name of the local branch.
        Returns:
        remote branch name or null remote tracking reference exists.
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • isHead

        public static boolean isHead(Reference branch)
        Determine if HEAD points to the given branch
        Parameters:
        branch - A reference to a local branch.
        Returns:
        true if HEAD points at the branch, false if it isn't
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • isCheckedOut

        public static boolean isCheckedOut(Reference branch)
        Determine if any HEAD points to the current branch

        This will iterate over all known linked repositories (usually in the form of worktrees) and report whether any HEAD is pointing at the current branch.

        Parameters:
        branch - A reference to a local branch.
        Returns:
        true if branch is checked out, 0 if it isn't,
        Throws:
        GitException - git error

      • remoteName

        public static String remoteName(Repository repo,
                                String canonicalBranchName)
        Find the remote name of a remote-tracking branch

        This will return the name of the remote whose fetch refspec is matching the given branch. E.g. given a branch "refs/remotes/test/master", it will extract the "test" part. If refspecs from multiple remotes match, the function will return GIT_EAMBIGUOUS.

        Parameters:
        repo - The repository where the branch lives.
        canonicalBranchName - complete name of the remote tracking branch.
        Returns:
        remote name or null when no matching remote was found,
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors

      • upstreamRemote

        public static String upstreamRemote(Repository repo,
                                    String refName)
        Retrieve the upstream remote of a local branch

        This will return the currently configured "branch.*.remote" for a given branch. This branch must be local.

        Parameters:
        repo - the repository in which to look
        refName - the full name of the branch
        Returns:
        name of the upstream remote
        Throws:
        GitException - git errors
